intro: Angolam, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often cultivated as a houseplant due to its compact size and ornamental value. Angolam prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, white, and yellow.
